samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. Their work was officially released in 1995. R was developed as an implementation of the S programming language, combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. Since its initial release, R has been maintained by the R Core Team and has become widely used for statistical computing and data analysis.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand in the early 1990s. Their work was officially released in 1995. R was developed as an implementation of the S programming language, combined with lexical scoping semantics inspired by Scheme. Since its initial release, R has been maintained by the R Core Team and has become widely used for statistical computing and data analysis.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first "official" stable release of R, following earlier beta versions. R itself was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman in the early 1990s and has continued to evolve through the work of the R Core Team since that initial stable release.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first "official" stable release of R, following earlier beta versions. R itself was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman in the early 1990s and has continued to evolve through the work of the R Core Team since that initial stable release.
